headline: Bernie Sanders campaign blames the media for candidate's slip in the polls
subHeadline: Sanders campaign manager slams the coverage of the Democratic presidential candidate; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everyone. I'm Juan Williams along with Katie Pavlich, Jesse Watters, Dana Perino, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, this is “The Five.” The squad renewing their feud with Nancy Pelosi, the four progressive congresswomen, once again, criticizing the speaker even after she strongly rebuked President Trump's controversial comments about them.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Are you speaking to Nancy Pelosi?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Our teams are in communication --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Which shouldn't it be a face to face with --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I agree, yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: She's the new member, not the speaker.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: No --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: She has every right to sit down with her in any moment, any time with any of us. She is Speaker of the House. She can ask for a meeting to sit down with us for clarification. The fact of the knowledge is not been racial justice working our country for a long time, acknowledge the fact that we are women of color. So when you single us out, be aware of that and what you're doing. Especially, because some of us are getting death threats, because some of us are being singled out in many ways because of our background, because of our experiences, and so forth.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And a moderate Democrat, slamming the squad for threatening to primary him. Here's Texas Congressman Henry Cuellar.

utterances.speaker: REP. HENRY CUELLAR, D-TX
utterances.sentences: There this group called the justice Democrats. I think they're not Democrats. Quite honestly, they're socialists, and they want to impose their vision to Texas, and we certainly know that in Texas, our vision is very different. Their vision is not the vision of most Americans.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana, this is so interesting. So here they are at a time when you think, you know, President Trump has opened the door to Democrats getting back together. Now they're being critical of Nancy Pelosi for not getting together. And I wonder if you think that when they mentioned the death threats and saying Pelosi should be careful in criticizing them, do they have a point?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: Well, I would -- I don't know. I'm not saying the threat assessment, but I'm assuming that there are many people including -- and in particular, Nancy Pelosi who probably has had death threats against her for decades. So, death threats are wrong across the board. And actual shooting --

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: Way to take a stance.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know, I've been working on that all day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I also think that their interview with Gail King I believe showed -- there must be a lot more division within the Democratic caucus than we even realized, because instead of them saying we'd love to do an event with you, Nancy Pelosi, thank you for putting the resolution on the floor, thank you for going through all of that when there was a mix-up and kerfuffle on the rule, and let's all -- might have a suggestion, would you stand with us? Would you come with us? We would love to be -- they don't want that. I think they want this fight with Nancy Pelosi. And I think that they're isolating themselves away from the Democratic caucus forgetting about President Trump. Here's the other thing I would say. Everybody has the opportunity right now to convene a meeting. That's one of the things that you have as a congress person or a senator or speaker or a president. If they wanted to get past this, they could all get together in a room, getting to know each other better, that always helps with things, but no one is suggesting that.  They're actually just saying -- they're saying that the speaker should come to them for a meeting? Like, I don't think so. I think Speaker Pelosi is wise, like, they could come to me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Greg, I noticed that the economist, you two have said that the three most unpopular Democrats among Trump voters are Ocasio-Cortez, Ilhan Omar, and Rashida Tlaib. By the way, number four is Pelosi. They're more popular among Trump voters and Pelosi, and then Elizabeth Warren who's number five. So all the top five are women.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, women. Oh, that is disgusting. You know what? I have a list here. Here's just a list I came up with, Jeff Sessions, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Mitt Romney, Rand Paul, Jim Acosta, Amazon, Jeff Bezos, Bloomberg, John McCain, Rosy O'Donnell, Mitch Mulvaney, Ted Cruz, Ted Cruz's wife, according to the media, they're all women of color, Dana, because Donald Trump only goes after women of color.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And you should be mindful of that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You should be mindful that he attacks women of color. No, he's a trash talker and he covers everybody. In fact, I think at this point, he has trash talked about every single person on the planet except for me because, you know, I'm such a pleasant person. This may be the most lopsided story we've ever covered because the media outrage is inversely proportional to the outrage of the public.  Summer time, people are out. You ask -- they're like -- this is about a tweet? You're talking about a resolution about a tweet? This is what you're talking about? You know, life is --isn't so bad. If this is the biggest story you've ever heard in your life. It's a tweet. By the way, who did it upset?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.sentences: When you walk home from walk do you talk to people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you know, I'm the man of the people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And then you have Al Green pushing -- Al Green pushing impeachment for his tweets? That would matter maybe if he wasn't pushing impeachment every day. He pushes it every day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Even Nancy Pelosi saying she will vote against Al Green's piece. I mean, that's why I say that there's divisions within the Democrat.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well -- OK, so, Jesse, is the president, though, aware that you got, you know -- Republicans who voted for the resolution Greg was referring to, which found that the president's tweet was deeply offensive and, of course, it's widely been condemned as racist, so you had Will Hurd of Texas, Bryan Patrick of Pennsylvania, Fred Upton of Michigan, Susan Brooks of Indiana, as well as Justin Amash all saying yes to what the Democrats --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Do I think Trump is aware of who these guys are?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I think, what do you --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think he is aware, and I think they're all dead to him. This is a rock solid coalition. They only had four defections. That's not a big deal. And the Reuters poll shows that Republicans were jump after this weekend. So I don't think he's worried about his base. His base is activated as activated it can be. For me, it's not about race. It's about respecting your elders. When I came on this show, Greg was so much older than I am, I was so differential. I never got out of line. I always acquiesced to whatever he wanted. And I always knew how to respect him because he was so much older than I am. And that's what this is about. These four freshmen --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's so unnecessary, this analogy. You could have use --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Are you not giving me permission to make an analogy?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You could have brought up your parents or your grandparents.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'll get to my mom in a second. You should see these texts after the squad got hit yesterday. These four freshmen came -- in the first five months, impeach the mother F-er. Israel is bad. Eliminate capitalism. Eliminate ICE. All of a sudden, you criticize them, they play the race card, the gender card, the Islam card. You can't say anything about them at all. And Nancy knows this, and that's why she's scared. And the mainstream media is protecting them. Meanwhile --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Nancy Pelosi is scared?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't think she's handled this smoothly, have you?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, I do think she's handled it pretty well.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You think Nancy has handled this well? They have now been elevated to basically Trump's opponent in 2020. He's running against people who a lot of people think hate America, and want socialism, and no one is talking about Joe Biden. Joe Biden is taking a nap.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. So, Katie --

utterances.speaker: KATIE PAVLICH, HOST
utterances.sentences: And their problem isn't just with Republicans, it's with Democrats outside of the beltway who also see these four as very toxic to the future of the Democratic Party --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's what I wanted to say. In fact, according to that YouTube economist poll, these people, these four who are, you know --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- are better known among Republicans than they are among Democrats. And I wonder if you think, therefore, this is helping or hurting President Trump to have made these racist comments?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I think that President Trump making these women the face of the Democratic Party as they want to be, they want to burn it down, they want their socialist policies to reign. Democrats are going to find out a whole lot more about who they are if they know who they are now because they're going to primary them. As we just saw Democrats are accusing them of being socialist who are trying to rip down and tear down the party.  This is beneficial to President Trump in this way. This will pass. The story will go away. The outrage over another offensive thing that President Trump said will go away. But the long-term implications of the rift within the Democrat Party on that side will certainly be a long-term problem. Not only just in presidential elections but in keeping the House with Nancy Pelosi.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't want us to become CNN, you know. You don't say something is racist. You say it's perceive -- if you believe it's racist, but that's not -- I don't believe it's racist. CNN can put it in their lowest third. We don't do that crap. We divide our facts from our opinions, so that's your opinion.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I will tell you, I don't think -- I mean --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- if you wanted to say, does Anthony Scaramucci think it's racist? Ah, I think --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, now you're -- Scaramucci.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no, I'm citing them as Republicans because I would give -- I would think that would give added credibility because I don't want you view this as --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I didn't know he had credibility in your life.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No -- OK. George Conway who's Kellyanne --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK. OK. I'll keep -- you want me to keep going. I mean, you can go through the A.P., the Associated Press. Everybody who previously was filling -- you know what you shouldn't --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, those guys are all objective before.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'll tell you, I don't see how you can get away from a comment that to me has been used to demonize people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What part of the comment bothers you again?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Against the Irish, the Italians, the Jews --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Go back to where you came from, fix it and come back. Racists don't ask you to come back.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: How about they're Americans? They don't have anywhere to go too. But, Katie, I just wanted to come to you and say this.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I mean, if we're going to talk about bad comments, I think we can go back to exactly what all of these women have said, including Ilhan Omar today who's talking about introducing legislation against -- or Israel with BDS, which actually hurts Palestinians. And she clearly doesn't really care about that. So, if we're going to talk about bad rhetoric let's not have a double standard from both sides --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Is there a chance that Trump really prefers --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I think the things that she said are pretty racist too.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK. Is there a chance that Trump prefers having these four as his targets rather than any -- because he doesn't have a Democratic --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: In fact, right now, the House of Representatives has just taking up -- debating right now the impeachment. And I think that will probably go down, but I think they'll bring it up over and over again. And the president is just been speaking to reporters and we're going to have that in just a moment for you because he's got some new things to say. You can say -- I don't like the tweet -- I said it the other day. I wouldn't never have sent it. I would never have said that. I can see how people think that it was the wrong thing to do. But I also think that with all -- like with the resolution, vote your heart, like whatever you want to do. But also know that no matter if you're a Republican, no matter what you do, it will never be enough.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It will never be enough. The next thing would be, like -- oh, so you think it's racist, OK. Then, what you're going to do? Are you going to leave the party? Oh, wait, here's the president.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hold on, Dana. We've to go to President Trump in the Rose Garden making some comments before he goes to this rally in North Carolina.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: No, if people want to leave our country, they can. If they don't want to love our country, if they don't want to fight for our country, they can. I'll never change on that. No.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you think you're winning this political fight?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I do think I'm winning the political fight --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I think I'm winning it by a lot.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I think that they are not espousing the views of our country, the four congresswomen. I think that they've said horrible things that the press doesn't cover. I think you should try covering it. When you look at some of the things they said, they're unthinkable. If somebody else, or me, or anybody else said things like that, it would be historic. So you ought to look at some of the horrible statements because there's never been statements like that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Mr. President, you've been very unspoken about the anti-Israel friend (INAUDIBLE) of the Democratic Party. How do you think that all began? And is there anyone in particular you blame on that?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Well, the Democratic Party is really going in a direction that nobody thought possible. They go as so far left they're going to fall off a cliff. So I think they're making a big mistake. But who knows. That's up to them.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Well, there's a lot of talk about the fact that she was married to her brother. I know nothing about it. I hear she was married to her brother. You're asking me a question about it. I don't know. But I'm sure that somebody will be looking at that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Sir, do you believe people should be allowed, sir, to --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Well, I think the story last night was that 187 Republicans voted in favor of Trump and four voted against. I think that was the big story. That seems to be the story. There's great unity in the Republican Party. It's very unfair what's happened with respect to the way -- I would say Republicans are being treated, frankly, but certainly way -- certainly the way this president has been treated. In the history of our country, there's never been anything like this. And this should never be allowed to happen to another president again. Should never be allowed to happen. Despite that, we've created the greatest economy in the history of our country. We're doing things like nobody has ever done. We have the best jobs numbers in the history of our country. African-American, Asian-American, women, Hispanic-American, best job numbers we've ever had. And I have to go because I see it's starting to pour.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I'm not relishing the fight. I'm enjoying it because I have to get the word out to the American people. And you have to enjoy what you do. I enjoy what I do. The key is -- the key is -- it's not a question of relishing. They're wrong. They're absolutely wrong. That's not where our country wants to be. We're not going to go and we're not going to be a socialist country. It's not going to happen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: President Trump on his way to North Carolina for a rally tonight. You can see some of it here on the Fox News Channel. And you see, he might as well be a member of THE FIVE the way he was reacting the questions that we were talking about. Katie, what did you think? Anything stand out?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I mean, he's just thinking the same argument that he's been making. I'm interested to see what he does tonight at his rally, if he extends his remarks to these four during his first rally since this thing has kicked off. He does think he's winning the political fight. We'll see, long term, if that's the case. But what he's saying about people can leave if they want to, reminds me of Hollywood actresses and musical artists who said they're going to move out of the country if Trump becomes president. They never did. These four aren't going to never leave it either, so we'll see what happens.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, Jesse, he seemed to be quoting Jesse Watters when he said, hey, it was four but they still have a unified Republican Party that has not reacted negatively to his controversial tweets.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, he is very confident that he's got the base behind him, and that's clear. He thinks he's winning the argument, and I think he is, too. Love it or leave is not controversial. It's not racist. The media is trying to make this out to be Charlottesville. They're making it out to be the S-hole country controversy. It doesn't even come close to that. If you think about what these four women had said about laughing about al- Qaeda, some people knocked down the towers, bragging about kicking out 25,000 jobs from New York City, abolishing capitalism, abolishing ICE, opening up the borders, and calling the president a Nazi rapist, to say that that is not controversial and love it or leave it is, shows how dishonest the press is. I think right now he'll go out and double down, triple down at the rally, and the media is not be able to do anything about it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana, one of the questions that was repeatedly shouted but the president didn't take was he has been critical of America in the past, and now he is going after these women and saying, hey, you've guys have been critical of the USA.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Go ahead, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Can I answer that, though, because I really, really want to answer that question. When he's saying that these people can't criticize me, that's not what he saying or criticize America. He's fixing problems. He ran on fixing problems in the country. He didn't just run to criticize. The Democrats who are in Congress are not fixing problems. They got in there, had the opportunity to fix the crisis at the border, send millions of dollars to these young kids in these detention centers, and they voted no to fund those detention --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think they just voted yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. They -- the four of them voted no to send money to the kids --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, you mean those four --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's not the Democrats. In other words, the Democrats --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, I'm talking about the squad. I am talking about the squad and so is he.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK, all right. Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know -- wait, what's the question?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, so -- one of the questions that was repeatedly asked --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, because he used to say -- like the American carnage speech. And he said America is the laughingstock of the world.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He was so harsh about healthcare, about the economy --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right, he was trying -- and he was saying these are the things that I want to try to fix. Now he's trying to make the case that he's fixed all those things or that they're on their way to being fix --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Healthcare?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm saying that's what he's saying. I'm not saying that is true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He's saying make America great again is now transitioning to his reelection effort which is keep American great. So all you have to do is conclude that he thinks that he has accomplished those things. He goes through the list. We go through the list over and over again of all the accomplishments. You start listing them out. Now these four or other members of Congress, they don't -- you don't typically run for Congress just because you don't like your country. Like, if you're going to actually run for Congress is because you think that you want to do something. The problem with these guys is that they don't have the votes and they're totally un-persuading. They do not persuade anybody except, possibly, within their blue districts. But that's not how you grow a coalition. It's not how you say -- look, we can give a little here -- you're not going to have a green new deal revolution. The revolution is not happening in 2020. And what Nancy Pelosi is trying to say is, this -- a lot of the stuff has to be incremental, so why don't we try to do this? Like, she's working her way through the system to try to keep that majority so that they could see if they can try to win back the White House and the Senate. Right now it looks like that -- absolutely isn't going to happen.  What was Tom Freidman's headline today in his column in the New York Times? He has asked over and over again this question, Donald Trump is going to win again, isn't he? And that's what all the Democrats are coming up to Tom Friedman and saying, I think right now the answer is, like, yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Can I just -- there is a difference in the criticism. Trump's criticism is predicated on what he perceives harms America. Their criticism is predicated on what America harms. So it's such a clear distinction, anybody can see it. It's the difference between radical leftist and patriotic Americans. Americans can criticize -- patriotic Americans can see what harms America. They only see what America harms. That is the underlying engine for those tweets which you talked about on Monday. Trump reacts in the perception of disloyalty. Now, you can disagree with that and find it simplistic and shallow and incorrected, but it ain't racist. It's based on a unifying concept of loyalty to your country. By the way, if you were born after 2000, you might find that whole idea so stupid and old fashioned like ribbon candy, you know, and bicycles with giant tires. Oh, what is patriotism? What is love it or leave it? It's an old concept, I agree.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think racism is very divisive.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I agree, too. Try to look for it sometime, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think we saw some of it. But I just wanted to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Where? Tell me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- ask you, one of the arguments also is that maybe the president is tweeting because he had some problems with the senseless --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: No, he saw the polling numbers last week that show that these people are toxic within the Democratic Party --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, especially among Republicans.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- and he decided to make them the face of the Democratic Party. And then Nancy Pelosi swoops in after she's accused of racism, and totally backs them with a resolution on the House floor, and she's back exactly where she was now trying to stay off impeachment. No good deeds, goes unpunished. She's now still being accused of racism and being told by the four that they need -- that she needs to watch her tone when she talks to them, because she needs to respect the fact that they have a different skin tones that she does.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And they are also toxic with white working class men and women in the rust belt which Democrats desperately need back. And it's in between the Democrat debates. Who else is he going to contrast himself up against? It's July, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Go low. More on “The Five” coming up next.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Well, it looks like Americans are no longer feeling the burn after sliding in the polls. Bernie Sanders campaign aides are apparently furious, and guess who they're blaming? The mainstream media. His campaign manager telling Politico, quote, this isn't intended to be a sweeping generalization of all journalist, but there are a healthy number who just find Bernie annoying, discount his seriousness, and wish his supporters and movement would just go away. And an anonymous campaign aide also saying, quote, every time there's a story about how Bernie can't win, it fans the flame of our base and we can get more donations and more volunteers. We'll never be the favorites in the media. So, Greg, Bernie is pretty sad. He's no longer getting the attention. Everyone stole his ideas and they're getting all the poll numbers and the money.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I get why they're mad. I mean, he manage to jerk the entire wheel from the party and drive the car headlong into Trump -- he just drove on the left side of the road and they -- but he has a point. I mean, for the Democrats, the media controls the narrative. CNN proved that when they corrupted a debate so he'll lose. The activist media decides who's gonna win, and they don't want him to win. Compare this to 2016, the media could not control the Republican voters because they think for themselves. You remember “The Five” in 2015? Microcosm of America. Everybody was scream -- at this table, we were screaming and yelling at each other.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Those were the days.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Those were the days. And, I mean, Fox, overall, was a noisy froth of disagreeable voices. We're all disagreeing with each other. But the media couldn't control the narrative. The Democrats have a real problem because the media does control their narrative. Whatever CNN picks, Democrats are going to do.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: But, Jesse, the people who cover Bernie say it's actually his fault because he's grumpy. He doesn't do gaggles or press conferences. He doesn't take any questions. He just leaves, and he always says the same thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, he's a horrible personality and it's degrading and irritating, and that he's never gonna change.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: People would see that and say that's a media person.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: People have to expect that. But I can't believe I'm saying this, Bernie is right. He gets a raw deal. They're biased against him. They were biased in 2016. They're bias again. He's consistently polled at number two nationally. Little slippage recently, consistently right at number two. He's raised more money than any other Democrat, $36 million. He has bigger crowds than any other Democrat, and he matches up very favorably head-to-head with Donald Trump. With that said, he whiffed at the debate and let Kamala steal everyone's thunder because he didn't contrast himself against the frontrunner. He should have just said, hey, man, I'm the original socialist. I dove into this pool head first. Everyone else is sticking their toes in. But I think deep down everybody knows he would get shredded by Trump in the general. And we saw that how radical he was when he said he wanted to let the Boston bomber vote from prison.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: But, Dana, I think the most telling indicator of Bernie's down fall is the polling numbers in New Hampshire with Elizabeth Warren taking over in his backyard.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. So we heard this before. The media is biased. The polls are wrong. And the system is rigged, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's their Trump.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It worked for somebody else. He's going to give it a shot. But who else said this before? Hillary Clinton, right? In 2008, she said that the media was biased against her because they wanted Obama to win. She said the same thing in 2016 when she was mad about Bernie. The thing about Bernie is that -- what he should have done for his legacy is not run for office this time, but what he should have done is give a big speech and said mission accomplished. I pulled the entire party to the left.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I have been able to make the DNC, the Democrat National Committee has completely changed its process to accommodate him, and all for somebody who is so reluctant to call himself a Democrat that he has to switch back and forth every time he wants to run for president.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: All right, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, he's not just attacking the media, by the way, he's also attacking the pollsters. And the pollsters are pretty consistent. Jesse's right that for the longest time he's basically been at number two, a good distance behind Biden, but consistently number two. But now he's not number two in many polls. And he's fading, that's the big problem. Now his people say that's because the pollsters don't capture young voters, you're all on cell phones and all the like, and they can't capture the energy of those young voters, and especially small young -- you know, small donors who are young voters who have given him a lot of money. Pete Buttigieg, actually, is the biggest surprise among donors on the Democratic side. But I would say my problem with Bernie is it feels to me like I've seen this movie before. It feels like a rerun. It's a little-bit like Trump and his Florida relaunch. Hmm, I think the reporters who covered him in 2016 could give the same speech because they've all heard it before. It's not much new here. And Bernie is boring on that level.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I think you can say the same thing about Joe Biden, Juan. But we will see--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. There we go.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: --all right, directly ahead.

utterances.speaker: DREW PINSKY, ADDICTION MEDICINE SPECIALIST
utterances.sentences: The people go why - why are you so concerned now? And there's one word rats. We have been - if you've seen what's happened with the rats, we have like 12 million rats in Los Angeles now. And the last time we had more than 2 million, plague broke out. If 2 percent of the rat population harbors plague, humans will get plague and that's all we need for - and with the millions of rats we have here, it's going to happen.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: All right. Health officials issuing a dire warning about the rat infestation in California and are demanding lawmakers act immediately. Dr. Drew Pinsky has been raising the alarm for months. He joins us next.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: How many must die? How many must die before you to drop the housing hoax and start dealing with this. We have a 1,000 so far in 2019, is it 1,200 is it 10,000. How many must die before you stop the rhetoric, stop the hoax and start dealing with the problem. How many must die? Gee, do I have to ask that question as a doctor?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That was Dr. Drew with Greg on Fox Nation with the homelessness crisis in California, hitting a breaking point. Health experts have been issuing dire warnings and an alarming new report saying the rise in homelessness is dealing a dangerous rat infestation in Los Angeles and other major cities across the state. Some of these experts are now demanding the governor stop ignoring the problem and declare a public health emergency. And we have a special treat, Dr. Drew Pinsky joins us now and is so good to have you here.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Thank you. It's a pleasure to be here. Big fan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You're quite passionate about this and for good reason.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: I am.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You scared me.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: I scared Greg. But as a physician I wake up every day looking at this and it incensed me. I practiced in the area for 30 years and of course one is one talk show host to another whom you should never trust the talk show host as he pointed out. But just--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I would agree.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: But just - and making sure we both - we understand - but I've practiced basically for years, please don't confuse my success in the media with my day job where I've been in the system - profession of clinical professor of medicine and psychiatry and I've run departments in the psychiatric. But these are my patients on the street. I know who they are. I've treated this population for years and it is ridiculous that they're calling it a home - a housing problem. It is ridiculous. The rat thing, I saw that coming 18 months ago. I predicted the typhus epidemic. It hit and is amongst us now. The problem is there are things that follow typhus. Given that they've done nothing for this rat population, there are other illnesses that will follow. We have tuberculosis exploding. We will see Yersinia, which you may know as plague. We have potential measles. We have people - their excrement and their bleeding and they're urinating in the street every day. That is getting washed directly with LA River. 60,000 people's excrement is getting into the river, into the ocean every day. If I had a city of 60,000 people that was disconnected from the sewage treatment plant, my god, the environmentalists would have - would freak out. Where are they? Then we have mammalian die-off off our coast now. Mammalian sea life - dolphins, sea lions dying because of all this garbage, untreated, going directly to the ocean, where's the help?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But what about the plastic straws?

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: The plastic straw got a turtle. But this is insane. We've gone insane. And unfortunately, the city of Los Angeles is maintaining this rhetoric that it's a housing problem. Look guys, conservatively - conservatively, the City of Los Angeles absorb about 800,000 undocumented immigrants in the last year or so. They're all living in a house. None of them are on the street. 800,000 people without a penny, without a family, without a country, found a place to live. Now either they push people into the streets, which I'm prepared to say, where they found a place to live. And this housing rhetoric is a hoax. It's a mental health crisis. This is an addiction crisis and it is a general health crisis.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: What do the hospitals look like in the ERs with--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Its catastrophe and we can't do anything for or to these people if they say I don't want treatment or care.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's what people are saying?

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: That's the problem. They don't want the care and we can't do anything to render the care. Unless we do something to change the Lanterman-Petris Act, which is what is the current law--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Is that a state or federal law.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: It's - I believe it's a federal decision, if I'm correct. But it has to be sort of modified in some way to include a broader definition of gravely disabled that includes inability to care for your nutrition or your medical needs, so people can help these people. Right now most - this is the dirty little secret. Most of them don't want to help and don't want the housing and this because of the brain condition. Imagine, if they were demented patients walking around saying this, you'd be - people will be insensitive. This people--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, if it's that - well, then if the problem is as you've described, it wouldn't be the compassionate thing to say we have to find a way to help these people.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: 100 percent.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But instead what it looks like is, "Oh, you know what, rats, health - let's attack a vulnerable population --"

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, I beg your pardon.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: --these homeless people. And secondly, let's cite statistics that come - they're published, by guess what, the exterminators, the Orkin people and 23. And what do they say, "Oh, well, LA is not the - LA has the most rats, that's Chicago and others" But LA has rats and therefore we want to use the most dangerous pesticides to kill the rats. So they have a piece of legislation in two weeks--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: You guys have a simple question.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is this a conspiracy theory.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because in 2 weeks there was California State legislature. They are trying to say there is green alternatives and so you get the pest control people and the anti-homeless people--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Oh, there's green alternative--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Guys on my KBC show today I spent one hour with these pest control people. And they said, look, the problem isn't - their concern is that we're going to give this poison to the rats and it's going to eat by the mountain lions and the bears. It turns out the exact opposite. The professionals know how to do this in such a way that it preserves the ecosystem. And I have one question - only one question. The question is how many people must die? How many must die before you change the rhetoric? How many Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What do you mean? Right now--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: I would like to ask this to profession and politician--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The people in California--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: There are 1,000 dead, how many must die - and how many typhus deaths?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: --are not only concerned about people, they're concerned about the exterminators killing pets, killing wildlife--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: They are absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And so when you just come in and focus on rats and on homeless, you create that question--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Here is what is going to happen is if the non-professionals are going to put poisons out and that's going to kill the wildlife and the pets.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I think helping people is lot more important than killing rats or- -

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: What is - people?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Helping people.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: It's all important. But we must change. We must listen to experts. So must make changes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So I came up with a suggestion that I said to you. I thought that Donald Trump should declare a national emergency and form a task force--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: --put you either in charge or part of it.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: No, no. Put Juan in charge.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But it should be a nonpolitical group of experts--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Yes

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: --to tackle this problem.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Well, the good news is the governor put together group of experts - like 16 experts. All the politicians that have created this problem and I don't see any experts on--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. No, you have to be--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: --that really know what they're doing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: --there needs to be a surge.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: But here's the deal. The guy named Reverend Andy Bales, who's run the LA Union Mission for 20 years. He is - he's been struggling with this population for decades. He looked at me two weeks and goes, we have to have a FEMA style intervention here. FEMA style emergency with the National Guard triage people - sprung tents - hundreds of sprung tents around the city, around the county and we just have to go out and--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what, we've finally reached the point of agreement, because I think that it's not about anything that any individual can do, but we need the government - Republicans and Democrats--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, government did a great job.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Government indeed--

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: I'm good. I just want people to be healthy. I want the government of healthy people thank.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Dr. Drew, thank you. We love having you.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: OK. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How many lines.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: How many must die?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: "Fastest 7" is up next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Welcome back. Time for the "Fastest 7". There it is. First up. Sometimes you have to take the law into your own hands. A Missouri woman did just that by stealing her own car back from thieves after 48 hours of amateur sleuthing. She finally hunted them down by tracking purchases made on her credit card near a local Applebee's.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh my god. So before I call the cops, I wanted to show you guys what I just found - got my car back. There she is and I have a picture of her with that same shirt on. And those are mine, give me my shoes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Ah-a, back up.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I have nothing to do--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: She has my wallet in her hand and my keys in her hand.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I mean, I guess the phone was in the car while it was going around, Greg, and then she saw everybody swiping and they followed her to an Applebee's, and "Those are my shoes".

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's something - like who steals cars anymore so casually. Like there has to be - Applebee's after you steal a car. There is something that--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I need a Ossum Blossom.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: --not in this story that should be in this story that they - maybe they know each other. Also, well, somebody tell me if it's that easy to steal a car. Because when we watch the action movies, all you got to do is take the two wires - and you go like this. And then anybody can steal--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: With the screwdriver.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And then you put in screw - I don't believe it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dana, you've stolen a lot of cars--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, gone in 60 seconds.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, little matchbox cars.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think that this is amazing. I think she probably watched a lot of SPU and she could figure it out. It's pretty interesting what you can do now with Find My Phone, things like that. You are trackable, not just by the police, but by people that you're stealing from. Not cool.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Would you ever do this Juan or would you just call 911 right away?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I will call 911, because I mean - this lady looks like she's in shock that she's been found out. But they're violent, crazy people who steal cars and I don't want to deal with them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, you and I agree for the first time today.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I mean, the lady stole her car and put on all of her clothes--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That is weird.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That's so bizarre.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That is so weird.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't knock it tell you try--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: They don't say that criminals are the smartest--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And they didn't look like they were the same size. It looks--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That was very nice Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: By the way in the video it looks like the steering wheel is on the wrong side. What she steal a British car?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I think it's the opposite.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't know. Anyways, up next drugs are bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And alligators on drugs are even worse. Police in Tennessee are asking residents to stop flushing their drugs down the toilet, Greg, warning that doing so may taint the water supply and create a mutant species of hyper aggressive meth-gators.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I wish this was true. I already have bought the rights to the movie of meth-gator. So Tara Reid is going to play the marine biologist that discovers one of these meth-gators in a swamp while studying frogs. Dean Cain placed a sanitation worker who notices the connection between the shenanigans at the sewage treatment plant and the Gators. Of course, Tara and Dean Cain they fall in love, they cross paths, fall in love and fight the meth-gator themselves who is played by Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It must be good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm going to theater for that, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know, we spent a long time in South Carolina. I'm scared about this. And we also - we've tried to be very good about you, all you have to do is you can take--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Would you flush your meth? What do you do with your meth, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My meth, I keep it in the safe. But you just take it back to your drugstore and you put it in the little special box.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't - you know they have a special box for the meth?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No questions--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know, Dana Perino, the meth expert.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What is meth? Is meth bad?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is meth bad. OK. Moving on - Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: By the way, I'm so disappointed in Greg, because normally Greg says there's something wrong with this story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, there is something. I know what you're going to say--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: There's something wrong. Because to me, first of all, it would be a high level of dilution if you flush it down the toilet.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But secondly, I mean let's - I mean, if you want say, I'll say this. Don't do drugs don't flush them. But I think the cops are saying, "Hey, you guys don't flush the drugs, because we want to bust you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, Juan, I think you're right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There isn't really a meth-gator.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: --meth-gators.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's bad for the water supply.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: If there was a meth-gator what would it look like?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No teeth?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: No, maybe not, maybe their teeth start falling out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what it looked like, Anthony Kiedis. It would look like Anthony Kiedis.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: But the side effects of meth are very bad.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Very bad.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: --gators want to keep their teeth erect, when they don't do meth.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Good idea.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Gators didn't have teeth that would actually be a good thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: True.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So you're saying then they just put gators on meth, so they lose their teeth?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're terrible person, Dana.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. And finally it is World Emoji Day and we're celebrating by showing you which ones we use the most or which ones we like the most. Dana's favorite emojis.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We have crying.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Crying with laughter.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, laughing, crying. Mine too. Shocked, awkward teeth emoji--

utterances.sentences: That's a grimace.

utterances.sentences: That's a grimace like yikes.

utterances.sentences: What she does when you talk?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, when you talk.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: When you talk.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK. Thank you. And then turtle, which I don't get, what's that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's a secret.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is it a meth turtle?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, it's a cocaine turtle.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Seems like the majority leader. Jesse's favorite emojis.

utterances.sentences: We have the heart. Such a lover. Crying laughing, like Dana, the rolling of the eyes, which I love and that fire.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What's that fire for?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Anytime anyone looks cute or hot or--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: --cute or hot. That's why it's like one of the most used - or when I make a really good point.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I know it's humility.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, Juan, that stands for humility. Juan's favorite emojis are--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The balloon, the sunglasses, because he's so cool and heart.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Like this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That guy. Katie's favorite emojis.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We have the American flag --very patriotic. The kiss and the hug.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I thought that was an excited thing, not--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's like jazz--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: No, you're like so slow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And drumroll please, Greg's favorite emoji.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Poop.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: At least its happy poop.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dr. Drew's favorite emoji.

utterances.sentences: Look how happy the poop is.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, little happy poop.

utterances.sentences: Its filled with meth.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Let's go. "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.sentences: Time now for "One More Thing", Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right it's time for this.

utterances.sentences: Dana's Crony Jokes.

utterances.sentences: Because they don't peel - so they don't peel.

utterances.sentences: Yes, yes. Very good. OK. Where did the sheep go on vacation?

utterances.sentences: Bahamas.

utterances.sentences: Well, how does everybody know these things?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Excellent.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Very good. OK. How can you tell that the ocean is friendly?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It waves.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do you guys - they gave them to you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm closing my eyes. I close my eyes the whole time.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: They're cheating.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They gave. Why do you - why do fish like to eat worms?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't know - they get hooked.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. But you know what, I'm calling Johnny, Cake (ph) on this.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes, Johnny.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They gave these answers to you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I can't believe you think these were that hard.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I didn't get any of them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You need them for your kids, there you go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. It's my turn. Here we go. I had a day off yesterday and I decided to venture into the wild.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I took the grandkids to the National Zoo in D. C. and we were fearless. Here we are wrangling wild animals on the carousel. Here's Pepper on a cheetah. You see me in the background on a Lama. Here's Wesley on a gorilla and here's Eli on an elephant. We also got to stop by the reptile house and expressed ourselves through art here we are tracing patterns on snake scales. And on our way to the big cats, we stopped for a photo op on top of a bear cub statue. I hadn't been to the zoo in a while, so I forgot how much fun it was to answer the call of a wild.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No meth-gators.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No. No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: --dancing on those animals in cages.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I know it's terrible, right. OK. Gregory, you're up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh me?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What am I doing. Oh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Animals are Great!"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Let's check.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why is this guy so happy? Why is he so happy? He's happy, because I've got a Fox Nation now available it's with Dr. Drew, still sounded off on the homeless crisis. Man, he goes off. Plus, I got a brand new podcast that's at Fox News--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: podcast.com

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: --podcast.com, thank you. I talked to former "Red Eye" fan favorite Alison Rosen. And she's - it's a great it's a great podcast. We walked down memory lane and stumped down it. And that's it for me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Jesse, you're up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Have you ever been to a fun house?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, they can be very dangerous when they have those Hall of Mirrors.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Look at this little tyke have some problems.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: oh, no.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Why do they probably show the ones that - where they could hurt.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No one got injured. The family licensed the video. Everyone is fine, Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's not what I heard. I heard the kid is in intensive care, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not true. Fake news just like the meth-gator. Also I'm on Martha tonight, "Wednesdays with Watters" and set your alarms tomorrow morning, Fox & Friends, baby.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What are you doing to yourself?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. Katie you are up.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, a pair of penguins were caught red flippered. They were sneaking into a sushi restaurant in Wellington, New Zealand, Monday evening. They were waddling vagrants. And this is there second act of vandalism. They were repeat offenders. And you can see them waddling into the restaurant and the staffers there notice something was amiss after hearing a cooing and humming sound from the kitchen.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, my god.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And they were identified. And the cops came in to get them and they were hiding from them underneath the refrigerator.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They are smart.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So police worked with the Department of Conservation and the Wellington Zoo to send the adventurous birds back to--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And do you know that's probably like the most controversial thing that happened in New Zealand all week.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let me tell you New Zealand, I'm with you girl.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Girlfriend.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Girlfriend, I will be in New Zealand.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: You're so right now.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We had meth-gators in New Zealand - that's what we have. All right. Set your DVRs, never miss an episode of “The Five.” "Special Report" up next with Bret Baier.
